title: Cardano's Djed Deploys on Ethereum-Compatible Sidechain: Details - U.Today
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Djed Alliance, the creator of the Djed stablecoin, has launched a new deployment of its protocol on Cardano's EVM-compatible sidechain, Milkomeda-C1. This is the third deployment of Djed and the first on Solidity, the main programming language for Ethereum smart contracts. The new deployment is expected to expand to other EVM-compatible blockchains. Additionally, the Dead Pxlz NFT project is launching a new game in the Cardano ecosystem, and the Cardano builder IOG has provided updates on ecosystem developments in its weekly report.

title: Popular Analyst Predicts Looming Ethereum Price and Altcoins Crash - CoinGape
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Popular analyst Michael van de Poppe predicts a looming crash in Ethereum price and altcoins due to bearish market momentum. Ethereum is under pressure after the Shanghai upgrade, and altcoins are losing momentum against Bitcoin. The collapse of First Republic Bank may trigger DeFi adoption. US Fed rate hike decision and debt ceiling crisis may put additional pressure on the government and banks. Van de Poppe predicts BTC price reaching $50,000 in the next quarter despite macro weakness and bitcoin halving.

title: Ethereum [ETH] sharks and whales are not backing away from the coin, here’s why - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum (ETH) sharks and whales are not selling despite the coin's 33.93% drop in the last year. On-chain data shows that the number of addresses holding 1,000+ ETH increased by 5.7%. This suggests that these holders have a long-term bullish outlook. However, development activity on the Ethereum blockchain has slowed down, with the metric down to 53. The 365-day MVRV ratio of Ethereum is at 22.79%, indicating that sharks made profits over the last year. While whales have turned to spot buying opportunities, overall activity on the network has slowed down, with active addresses dropping from 7.9 million to 5.8 million. Despite this, the coin's circulation has improved, with a 4.41% increase in the last 24 hours.

title: Bitcoin Could Jump Nearly 70% If the US Defaults: Standard Chartered - Markets Insider
summary: Bitcoin could jump by nearly 70% if the US defaults on its debt, according to Standard Chartered's Geoff Kendrick. He believes that bitcoin's reputation as a safe haven asset will help it perform well in periods of stress. However, he also notes that the cryptocurrency may not rally in a straight line and could potentially dip before jumping. Kendrick suggests a long bitcoin, short ethereum trade as the optimal strategy in this scenario. The warning of a catastrophic default by Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen has investors on edge, with yields on three-month Treasurys reaching a 22-year high. Bitcoin has already rallied 80% so far in 2023, but could potentially see further gains if a default occurs.

title: Polygon Labs and Google Cloud Join Forces to Boost Ethereum Ecosystem - Geeks World Wide
summary: Polygon Labs and Google Cloud partner to enhance Ethereum scaling protocol infrastructure and tools, simplifying development process for Web3 products and DApps. Google Cloud's Blockchain Node Engine integration helps eliminate the need for Polygon developers to configure and run nodes, while advancements in Polygon zkEVM beta are expected to reduce transaction costs and increase deployment throughput. The partnership positions Polygon as a leading Layer 2 in the Ethereum ecosystem and sets the stage for further blockchain technology adoption.

title: Tron (TRX): Justin Sun's Decentralized Internet - DailyCoin
summary:
Here are the main points from the article in less than 256 tokens:

1. Tron (TRX) is a Layer-1 blockchain network focused on providing a decentralized internet for the masses.
2. Tron was founded by Justin Sun in 2017 and has since grown to become one of the largest blockchains in the industry.
3. The Tron network features a delegated-Proof-of-Stake consensus mechanism and supports smart contract and dApp development.
4. Tron has a high transaction throughput of up to 2,000 TPS and low transaction fees of around $0.000005.
5. The Tron blockchain has a TVL (Total Value Locked) of over $10 billion, second only to Ethereum.
6. Despite its growth and popularity, Tron lags behind other Layer-1 blockchains like Solana and Aptos in terms of scalability and transaction volume.
7. Tron has a relatively low level of developer activity compared to other chains, with fewer than 100 developers building on the network.
